Kapan Bunga Bank Turun? LPS: Butuh Waktu
06 Nov 2019, 08:07 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Foto: Dok. Bank Indonesia

Jakarta - Komisi XI DPR RI hari ini menggelar rapat kerja dengan Lembaga Penjamin Simpanan (LPS). Dalam rapat itu, Ketua Dewan Komisioner LPS Halim Alamsyah mendapat pertanyaan terkait perang bunga yang terjadi di perbankan nasional.Menanggapi hal tersebut, Halim mengungkapkan saat ini perbankan sudah dalam tren penurunan suku bunga seiring dengan menurunnya bunga di bank sentral. "Sekarangkan tren suku bunga sudah turun. Baik bank sentral maupun perbankan. Untuk perbankan memang butuh waktu untuk menurunkan. Karena tidak bisa langsung turun saat bunga acuan BI turun," kata Halim di Gedung DPR, Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).Dia mengungkapkan, biasanya penurunan bunga akan terjadi lebih dulu oleh bunga simpanan. Kemudian baru diikuti oleh suku bunga kredit. Menurut Halim, penurunan suku bunga di perbankan ini diharapkan bisa mendorong permintaan kredit dan menggerakkan perekonomian nasional.Dia menjelaskan rendahnya biaya dana yang dikeluarkan bank maka akan mempengaruhi perhitungan suku bunga kredit. Hal ini akan mempengaruhi pada pertumbuhan kredit yang nantinya mendorong pertumbuhan ekonomi."Kalau kredit inikan tergantung demandnya, kalau pertumbuhan ekonominya membaik ya mereka akan baik, tantangannya akan besar juga," ujarnya. Berdasarkan data uang beredar yang diterbitkan BI suku bunga kredit pada Juli 2019 turun 1 bps yakni 10,72% dibandingkan periode bulan sebelumnya 10,73%. Sementara itu untuk suku bunga simpanan berjangka atau deposito tenor 1 bulan 6,68% turun dibandingkan periode bulan sebelumnya 6,76%. Untuk tenor 3 bulan 6,78% turun dibandingkan periode Juni 2019 6,79%. Sementara untuk tenor 6 bulan bunga deposito tercatat 7,24% dibandingkan periode bulan sebelumnya 7,34% dan jangka waktu 24 bulan atau 2 tahun tercatat 7,02% dibandingkan periode bulan sebelumnya 7,34%.Simak Video "Suku Bunga AS Naik, BI: Ekonomi RI Stabil"[Gambas:Video 20detik](kil/fdl)

When does bank interest go down? LPS: It takes time
Nov 6, 2019, 8:07 AM by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Photo: Doc. Bank Indonesia

Jakarta - Commission XI of the Indonesian Parliament today held a working meeting with the Indonesian Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS). During the meeting, Chairman of the Board of Commissioners of LPS Halim Alamsyah received a question related to the war of interest that occurred in the national banking sector. Responding to this, Halim revealed that the banking sector was currently in a downward trend in line with the decline in interest rates at the central bank. "Now the trend in interest rates has gone down. Both the central bank and banks. For banks, it really takes time to reduce. Because it cannot go down immediately when the BI benchmark rate falls," Halim said at the Parliament Building, Jakarta, Wednesday (11/06/2019) He revealed, usually a decrease in interest will occur first by the deposit interest. Then only followed by loan interest rates. According to Halim, the decline in interest rates in the banking system is expected to drive credit demand and drive the national economy. He explains the low cost of funds incurred by banks will affect the calculation of loan interest rates. "If credit is dependent on demand, if economic growth improves, they will be good, the challenges will be great," he said. Based on the money supply data issued by BI, the lending rate in July 2019 decreased by 1 bps, which is 10.72% compared to the previous month period of 10.73%. Meanwhile, interest rates for time deposits or 1-month tenor deposits were 6.68%, down from 6.76% in the previous month. For 3-month tenors 6.78% decreased compared to the June 2019 period 6.79%. While for the 6-month tenor the deposit interest was recorded at 7.24% compared to the previous month period of 7.34% and the period of 24 months or 2 years was recorded at 7.02% compared to the previous month period of 7.34%.
